flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction: There are tons of these on Etsy and other crafty type sites, but nothing beets making your own. I wanted to be able to make a sharp useful bread knife to accompany my wife's home made bread as a gift for family and friends.
guide.introduction_rendered: There are tons of these on Etsy and other crafty type sites, but nothing beets making your own. I wanted to be able to make a sharp useful bread knife to accompany my wife's home made bread as a gift for family and friends.

lines.text: First i made a solid block of wood 2" x 2" x 18" long. I used thin layers of cherry and poplar that i had in the shop so that the final project would have stripes of alternating color.
lines.text_raw: First i made a solid block of wood 2" x 2" x 18" long. I used thin layers of cherry and poplar that i had in the shop so that the final project would have stripes of alternating color.

lines.text: I also needed to buy blades for cutting bread. I researched bread blades and found amazon.com sells replacement blades for an industrial bread machine. I bought a full set of 32 from Oliver for $50.

lines.text: These are the knives i purchased.

guide.summary: This is based on a project I found elsewhere online. I created my own design and fabricated a few of the knives as gifts. My wife also makes bread, so this will be a great addition to the xmas gifts.
guide.title: Handmade Bread Knife
